content.description: The height requirement for a certain ride at an amusement park is <math alttext="48" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>48</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> inches or taller. The distribution of height of six-year-old children is approximately normal with mean <math alttext="45.2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>45.2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> inches and standard deviation <math alttext="1.75" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.75</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> inches.
content.question: Which of the following is closest to the probability that a randomly selected six-year-old child will not meet the height requirement for the ride?

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Determine relative frequencies, proportions, or probabilities using simulation or calculations.
